title: Valentine prompt single-page with evasive No and Good choice meme reveal

requirements.summary: Build a single-page Valentine prompt UI asking “Will you be my Valentine?” with exactly two choices: Yes and No.
acceptanceCriteria: The page displays the question "Will you be my Valentine?" in English.
There are exactly two visible choice controls labeled "Yes" and "No".
The UI is fully usable on iPad Chrome in both portrait and landscape orientations.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page Valentine prompt view with the question text and exactly two visible controls ("Yes" and "No"), ensuring responsive layout for iPad Chrome portrait/landscape. Use the shadcn-ui Button component to provide consistent, accessible buttons (verify the component's usage instructions before implementing).

requirements.summary: Make the No button evasive on both desktop and touch devices so it moves away before it can be clicked/tapped, staying visible and not overlapping key UI.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: when the pointer moves over/near the "No" button, the button repositions so it cannot be clicked.
On touch devices (iPad): attempting to tap/press the "No" button causes it to move away before a click/tap is registered.
The "No" button remains within the visible viewport and does not overlap the "Yes" button or the main question text.

file_operations.description: Implement a reusable hook that computes and updates an evasive position for the "No" button using pointer events (e.g., onPointerEnter/onPointerMove/onPointerDown and touch equivalents), constraining movement within a defined container and avoiding overlap with the "Yes" button and question region.

Wire the evasive behavior into the "No" button: render it with position controlled by useEvasiveNoButton, attach desktop and iPad-friendly interaction handlers that trigger repositioning before a click is registered, and ensure it stays within the visible prompt container without overlapping the question text or "Yes" button.

requirements.summary: On Yes click/tap, transition to a meme image view that visibly contains the exact text “Good choice”.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping "Yes" reliably switches the view from the question/buttons to the meme image.
The meme image contains the exact text "Good choice" visibly in the image.
The "Yes" interaction works on iPad Chrome (touch) and desktop browsers (mouse/keyboard).

file_operations.description: Add UI state to switch from the prompt view to a result view when "Yes" is activated (mouse, touch, and keyboard activation), and render the static image at frontend/public/assets/generated/good-choice-meme.dim_800x600.png with appropriate sizing for iPad and desktop.

requirements.summary: Apply a romantic pink-and-white theme with a simple, charming layout and soft styling while keeping the experience self-contained.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary palette is pink and white (with optional subtle neutral accents).
Typography and spacing feel intentionally romantic (e.g., soft shapes, gentle shadows, rounded corners) while keeping the page simple.
No unrelated pages, navigation, or extra features are introduced beyond the Valentine prompt flow.

file_operations.description: Create global styles (including Tailwind base/components/utilities if used by the template) and define a pink/white romantic theme via CSS variables and base element styling; set a soft background treatment compatible with the heart pattern asset and ensure mobile/iPad-friendly spacing and typography.

Apply the romantic layout styling (rounded card, gentle shadows, pink/white palette) and use the subtle repeating heart pattern background from frontend/public/assets/generated/hearts-pattern-bg.dim_1920x1080.png as a page/container background, keeping the app as a single self-contained page.

requirements.summary: Add required generated images as static frontend assets and render them directly without any backend fetching.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in imageRequirements.required.
The frontend references these images via static paths and they render correctly in production build.
No backend endpoints or canister calls are used to serve images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static meme image asset with the exact filename and dimensions suffix so the frontend can render it directly (no backend involvement).
Add the generated subtle heart pattern background asset with the exact filename and dimensions suffix so the frontend can reference it as a static background (no backend involvement).

Ensure the UI references the generated images via static paths using frontend/public/assets/generated/good-choice-meme.dim_800x600.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/hearts-pattern-bg.dim_1920x1080.png, without introducing any backend/canister calls.
